results.title: Let's talk about sex (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Talking to children about sex is often difficult but this informative program on human growth and development covers all aspects of sex. It is straightforward, relaxed and creates an atmosphere for frank, open discussion. It is easy to understand, descriptive and unbiased.

results.title: Let's Talk about It
results.brief_description: The first three programs in this series follow the experiences of an upper primary school class as they learn about human reproduction and sexuality. The final two programs discuss the experience with the teachers and parents.

results.title: Let's talk about films
results.brief_description: An approach-to-film discussion showing some of the problems encountered and how they may be overcome. A group of leaders tries to recognize the factors leading to successful film discussion by observing an audience actively discussing a familiar film. In retrospect one of the group recalls being unable to arouse any response whatever with the same film. Why did one effort fail and the other succeed? These questions are closely examined by the group leaders in a workshop meeting; the centering of discussion in the group rather than in the leader is seen to be an effective technique.

results.title: Let's see
results.brief_description: The manufacture of lenses in the optical industry; craftsmen at work; testing of a lense surface; various machines in operation. Mining of sand in the highlands of Scotland. Factory processes; mixing and melting of ingredients to obtain glass, roughing, smoothing and polishing glass; cementing of lenses; use of lenses in filmmaking and in various phases of science and industry.

results.title: Let's play safe
results.creator_credit: William H Murray, John Sullivan and Portafilms
results.brief_description: The playground adventures of the Wrong Donkey, the Giddy Goose, the Foolish Fish, the Pushy Pig, the Dumb Bunny, and the Mock Monkey: using animation and stop-action photography, this film shows children in an amusing and easily remembered way how to avoid various playground accidents.

results.title: Let's not say goodbye
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: The destruction of Australia’s bushland and forests threatens already endangered species. Members of the Theatre in Education and the Real Fantasy Theatre Company take a humorous look at this serious problem.

results.title: Let's measure: inches, feet and yards
results.brief_description: An introduction, at junior level, to the subject of linear measurement. A young boy becomes interested in his own height and his curiosity is aroused about other measurement techniques. His father demonstrates the estimated measure technique when the boy wonders how far he has thrown a ball. The father and son practice guessing distances and have practical experiences in measuring length, width, height and distance.

results.title: Let's make puppets
results.creator_credit: Children's Library and Crafts Movement and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a simple method of making puppets; materials for the “Melbourne Method”; construction of the head; making the hands; manipulation of puppets; puppets in action. Of historical interest.

results.title: Let's make a film
results.brief_description: Explores the activities of the Yellow Ball Workshop, Newton, Massachusetts, which involves young people from the ages of eight through to eighteen who create their own animated films. Individual students demonstrate and discuss the steps involved in preparing their film and show the finished product.
